name: Naughty, Naughty Books Quiz | Specific Subjects & Themes | 10 Questions

questions.text: D.H. Lawrence was a favorite target of censorship advocates. Which work is NOT one of his?
questions.explanation:
The Woman in White.

	Many trials and struggles with "obscenity". "White" was by Wilkie Collins.

questions.text: Who said: "I can't define obscenity, but I know it when I see it"?
questions.explanation:
Supreme Court Justice.

	Potter Stewart. Now, he's stuck with the line forever.

questions.text: Henry Miller was targeted by censorship forces for "Tropic of Cancer" and "Tropic of Capricorn". Miller's personal life was also interesting: he had a relationship with his wife and with another (famous) woman (at the same time). Who was the "other woman"?
questions.explanation:
Anais Nin.

	His life style was apparently compatible with his writings.

questions.text: "Lolita" is a favorite target of censors. Who was the author?
questions.explanation:
Vladimir Nabokov.

	Middle-aged man meets young girl.

questions.text: "The Catcher in the Rye" was also a popular target. What was the name of the protagonist in the novel?
questions.explanation:
Holden Caulfield.

	William Holden and Joan Caulfield were names on a movie marquee. The rest is history. Demian is a character in the novel of the same name by Hesse. Similarly, Harry Haller is a character in Hesse's "Steppenwolf". Fortunato is a character in a short story by Edgar Allan Poe.

questions.text: Ibsen's "A Doll's House" was considered "outrageous" because of its content in what area?
questions.explanation:
Women.

	The opening shot in the women's lib movement?

questions.text: Thomas Hardy endured a great deal of criticism for some of his works. Which is NOT one of his novels?
questions.explanation:
The Possessed.

	"Jude" and "Tess" drew considerable heat. After a while, Hardy decided to stick to poetry. "Possessed" is by Dostoevsky.

questions.text: Which of these is sub-titled "Memoirs of A Woman of Pleasure"?
questions.explanation:
Fanny Hill.

	By John Cleland. "Early naughty".

questions.text: "Moll Flanders" also caught the eye of the critics and censors. Who was the author?
questions.explanation:
Daniel Defoe.

	Can we have a novel about a "loose woman" by a writer named Trollope?

questions.text: The term "Big Brother" has become a part of everyday jargon. Which banned book gives us this term?
questions.explanation:
1984.

	All of these had experiences being banned, but it was Orwell who gave us the term.
